title: India approves viability gap funding scheme for battery storage development - pv magazine International
summary: The Indian government has approved a $1.13 billion scheme to develop 4 GWh of battery energy storage systems (BESS) by 2030-31. The scheme aims to bring down the cost of BESS projects and increase their viability. BESS projects will allocate a minimum of 85% of their capacity to electricity distribution companies (discoms) to ensure consumer access to the scheme's benefits.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the scheme promotes the development of BESS projects, which contribute to environmental sustainability goals by enabling the integration of renewable energy into the electricity grid and reducing the need for expensive infrastructure upgrades.
business_innovation: TRUE, because the scheme introduces a new business model for BESS development, with financial support from the government in the form of VGF. This reduces the financial risk for developers and encourages private sector participation in BESS projects.
green_product: FALSE, because the article does not describe a specific green product.
green_process: FALSE, because the article does not describe a specific green process.
likely_naics_codes: ['221111 - Hydroelectric Power Generation', '221112 - Fossil Fuel Electric Power Generation', '221113 - Nuclear Electric Power Generation', '221119 - Other Electric Power Generation']
greenwashing: FALSE, because the article does not describe a product or process innovation that is an example of greenwashing.

title: Empowering India's engineering talent - CXOToday.com
summary: India is establishing itself as a strategic hub for highly skilled engineers. Multinational and domestic firms are tapping into India’s engineering workforce for digital transformation and other initiatives. To remain globally competitive, India must prioritize the reskilling and upskilling of its engineering talent. Investment in skilling and upskilling programs and collaboration between industry and academia will ensure India’s continued success.
